item.title: Lil help
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Opening a certain URL with a JButton is quite simple.

First off you must import net.URI

import java.net.URI;

Then declare an action listener to the button.

buttonname.addActionListener(this);

Now with normal ActionListening, under your

source.equals(button);

Or whatever your button’s name is.

You need to add the open new URI which will open the default browser when you click the button. Like so.

[code]if(Desktop.isDesktopSupported()) {
try {
Desktop.browse(new URI(“LINK HERE”));
} catch(Exception e) {

}

}[/code]

Sure there are other ways, like

Button source = (Button)ae.getSource(); String link = "http://www."+source.getLabel()+".com";
Which will open the link of the name of the button, so if you had a button named “google” the button would open www.google.com because the source.getLabel is getting the label name and opening it that way.

Read full topic

item.title: Lil help
item.dc:creator: @I_Samn_I I Samn I
item.description:
@I_Samn_I wrote:

I’m not sure how to do this and ive just started GUI work using Netbeans.

I wanted to add two radio buttons(done) which select the person’s browser type(done).

But could someone help me with my method so it finds out which radio button is choosen?

public static void URL(String url) { String browserPath = ""; browserPath = "C:/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox/firefox.exe"; try { String[] b = {browserPath, url}; Runtime.getRuntime().exec(b); } catch (Exception exc) { exc.printStackTrace(); } }

Since I’m using Netbeans i can use Actions so heres my actions:

@Action
public void FF() {
	browserPath = "C:/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox/firefox.exe";
}
@Action
public void IE() {
	browserPath = "C:/Program Files/Internet Explorer/iexplore.exe";
}

I was thinking of changing to booleans so i could do if(FF == true) { (I KNOW ITS NOT RIGHT).

Any ideas?

Read full topic
